result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:53 PM Defendant Daemon M. Hanna appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Daemon M. Hanna.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Eric Schoonover sworn in and testified by video.  Defense stipulates to Defendants identity. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests Preliminary Hearing by zoom. Preliminary Hearing set for September 26, 2022 at 3:30 PM. Bond to continue

3:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daemon M. Hanna appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Daemon M. Hanna. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address updated. Cash bond set of $500,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.M.J.'s family, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Kenyana Moton, must forfeit  any passport, May not leave state of Wisconsin, Maintain absolute sobriety. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits and by Zoom.
